borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
<p class="MsoNormal">The scale, siting and design of the proposed development
would result in the&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">loss of sunlight, daylight, outlook and overbearingness</span>&nbsp;to neighbouring occupiers, as well as being
situated in close proximity to the neighbouring dwelling in a manner which
presents an unneighbourly arrangement and may prejudice future development at
this property. As such, the development is contrary to:</p><p class="MsoNormal">- National Planning
Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021); </p><p class="MsoNormal">-
Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021); </p><p class="MsoNormal">- Policy CP3 of Local Development
Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010); </p><p class="MsoNormal">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the Local
Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March
2011); </p><p class="MsoNormal">- Policies SP2, DMD6 and DMD1 of The London Borough of Barking and
Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021);
</p><p class="MsoNormal">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document
(February 2012)<o:p></o:p></p>

The proposed development will erode the characteristic gap between dwellings and introduce a roof form of poor design, resulting in an unacceptable impact on the street scene. As such, the proposed development is considered harmful to the appearance of the house and character of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)

- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021)

- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)

- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)

- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012)

- Policies SP2, DMD1, DMD4 and DMD6 of The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)
description: Conversion of garage into habitable accommodation, construction of a ground floor front and side infill extension and construction of a first floor side and rear extension
